comment: She teaches straight from her power points. She isn't very good at giving other examples. She gives partial credit on her tests, but they have a lot of parts. Her lecture is VERY dry and boring.

Her cheat sheets are the best part of her class. Her lecture style involves reading the PowerPoints; I got along just fine in her class because I understood the math on my own, but if you're not able to do that, the class might be difficult. But, honestly, it's Math 1101. It's not that hard. If nothing else, take her for the cheat sheets.

Rosenblitt is a very nice lady but her class was terrible. She tried hard to be helpful but it just ended up being more confusing. I never attended class and never did a homework assignment. The quizzes were group so make sure you sit next to the smart kids.
Good professor. Very nice lady. Anwsers any questions and gives extra credit. DO follow along in class or will get lost. DO homework problems (though not required) if you want an A.

She is a good Professor. Let's you use cheat sheets on every test....even the final. Will explain anything you do not understand. Will help with problems on the test, during the test. Really nice lady. Do not have to go to class, just review days and you'll be fine. Does give a little extra credit, but helps a lot in the end!
Nice lady, but not a very good professor. I Didnt have any programming experience prior to class so it was hard for me. Also I asked for help via email a few times and she did not respond.

Not very knowledgeable about the field. Knows whats in the book, and tests on it. Does not know her way around Windows XP, which had me scratching my head. I've been in the field for over 20 years, and this class could have been much more informative and entertaining. Somewhat helpful, but seems a bit shy most of the time. Easy class if you study.

i had her for math for some reason, and i liked it.  a lot of pepole didn't like it, but if you take high school algebra before, then this class is really easy.  just take notes and study and you'll be fine.

I had a little programming experience before taking this class and I found it very easy. Just be sure to pay attention during class and be able to do the programming assignments to do well. Again, if you've programmed at all in the past this should be an easy A, as it was for me.

She's nice and helpful, but she's not a good professor. She will help you if you have any problem with assignments. I would say that her tests are not that hard, but you need to study for them. Some of the questions of the Final comes from previous tests.

If you take programming I with her, be prepared to study HARD.  She lectures very fast and doesn't really help prepare you for tests or assignments.  She's happy to answer questions, but her English makes it difficult for you to understand.  The tests and quizes are very tricky as well.

Prof. Rosenblitt has alot of knowledge of the Java Programming language, but does not know how to teach it.  She becomes frustrated easily if you don't understand her answer to your question the first time.  English is not her first language, and on some occasions that was an issue.
